oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Kingdom Hall of Jehovah's Witnesses, 2001 May
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of a Kingdom Hall of Jehovah's Witnesses located at 1400 Meridian Street in Nashville, Tennessee. All meeting places of Jehovah's Witness congregations are called Kingdom Halls. Often they are built by area member volunteers in a single weekend. This building's foundation is made of rough cut stone block that has been painted grey. The exterior walls are brick that has been painted white. The roof gabled and hipped and made of tar shingles. The windows have been bricked in. The doors are metal. An awning covers the front porch. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Kingdom Hall of Jehovah's Witnesses (Nashville, Tenn.)
